rdsi.pacelf.phase3:document.title: Transmission assessment surveys in the Global Programme to Eliminate Lymphatic Filariasis: WHO position statement
rdsi.pacelf.phase3:document.description: Overview: In 1997, the 50th World Health Assembly resolved to eliminate lymphatic filariasis as a public health problem. In response, WHO established the Global Programme to Eliminate Lymphatic Filariasis (GPELF) to assist Member States in achieving this goal by 2020. The global programme has 2 components: (i) to reduce prevalence of infection to levels at which it is assumed that transmission can no longer be sustained and (ii) to manage morbidity and prevent disability.
